Details: Both reports provide comprehensive reviews of Informatica to PySpark migration for PS_VENDOR workflow. Report_1 focuses on conversion accuracy and technical details with 8 structured sections, while Report_2 emphasizes functionality assessment and performance with 7 sections. Both conclude the migration is highly successful with ratings of 9/10 and 9.5/10 respectively.

Both reports address identical core objectives: reviewing Informatica PS_VENDOR workflow migration to PySpark. Key semantic alignments include: data source analysis (profrec_vendor.txt), transformation logic (AUD_YR_NBR and LOAD_DT), null handling, and Delta Lake output. Minor semantic differences in emphasis: Report_1 focuses more on conversion accuracy while Report_2 emphasizes performance and scalability.

Both follow numbered section structure but differ in organization. Report_1 uses 8 sections (Summary, Conversion Accuracy, Discrepancies, Optimization, Assessment, Recommendations, Rating, API Cost) while Report_2 uses 7 sections (Overview, Functionality, Performance, Code Quality, Testing, Recommendations, Conclusion). Similar logical flow but different decomposition approaches.

Report_1 is syntactically correct with proper formatting, consistent terminology, and accurate technical references. Minor issue: workflow name inconsistency between 'wkf_m_aufi016d_PS_Vendor' and 'm_aufi016d_PS_Vendor' in different sections.
Report_2 is syntactically correct with excellent formatting, consistent workflow naming 'm_aufi016d_PS_Vendor' throughout, proper technical terminology, and well-structured content organization.
Both reports demonstrate high syntactic correctness with proper formatting and technical accuracy. Average score reflects minor naming inconsistency in Report_1.
Strengthen workflow name consistency throughout the document. Consider standardizing section organization for future reports.
Excellent structure and consistency. Consider adding more detailed API cost breakdown as shown in Report_1.

Both reports are high-quality with complementary strengths. Report_1 provides detailed conversion accuracy focus while Report_2 offers comprehensive performance analysis. Consider combining structural approaches for future migration reviews.
